result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian James Ziegler Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Amounts due on Count #1 are payable as a condition of probation on Counts #2 and #3. A civil judgment will be entered against the defendant if not paid in full by the due date.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: count #1

miscConds.notes: Amounts due on count #1 are also payable as a condition of probation. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall take and complete a hunter safety course.
Defendant shall not possess firearms or other dangerous weapons.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Count #1 and #2

Defendant Brian James Ziegler Jr in court. Attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin. Paige Ziegler in court. Brian Ziegler Sr appeared by video. Matter before the court on Brian Ziegler Sr's and Paige Ziegler's petitions for return of property. Witness: Paige Z.; Brian Z. Sr. Court places findings on the record. Court orders that the .380 handgun be returned to Paige Ziegler as long as it is being kept with her step-father Mr Betts. Court orders that the AR-15 rifle be returned to Brian Ziegler Sr. Mr Ziegler Sr. has until December 1, 2022 to obtain the firearm from the Washington Co Sheriff's office.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian James Ziegler Jr in court, in custody. Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Brian James Ziegler Jr.  Matter before the court on defense request for anticipated disposition. Agreement reached and outlined to the court. Case passed and recalled. Court invites further basis be presented for the proposed agreement. Statements by counsel. After further explanation by counsel, the court accepts the agreement. State to file Amended Information within 48 hrs. Count #1 amended on State's motion to Endanger Safety by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon in violation of Sec. 941.20(1)(a) Wis. Stats, Def pleads guilty to count #1 as amended, count #2 and count #3; def is convicted. Argument by counsel on sentence. Statements by defendant. Defendant sentenced.
